profile.name: Jadal Williams
profile.title: Graduate Researcher and Computer Vision Specialist
profile.summary: Ph.D. Student in Mechanical Engineering at MIT with expertise in robotics and computer vision, holding a strong track record in academia, startups, and professional internships.

education.summary: Focused on Path Planning, Computer Vision, and Human-Robot Interaction.

work.name: MIT Sports Lab
work.summary: Conducting computer vision and machine learning research to assist professional sports with player tracking, health, and officiating.

work.name: Tulip Interfaces
work.summary: Streamlined product roadmaps, enhanced cross-department collaboration, and developed algorithms to track organizational OKRs.

work.name: MIT d’Arbeloff Lab
work.summary: Conducted computer vision research in robotics, publishing work on object classification and robot trajectory prediction.

work.name: Cazarme
work.summary: Co-founded B2B SaaS startup that uses AI to help companies extract actionable insights from user research interviews, Backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners and Accel.

work.name: Adobe
work.summary: Developed a centralized search prototype, enhancing productivity by analyzing and organizing user research data.

work.name: Codepath
work.position: Android App Dev Mentor for Facebook University
work.summary: Guided 120 freshman and sophomore college students from diverse backgrounds through Facebook Universityâ€™s Android App Development Bootcamp.

work.name: Facebook
work.summary: Developed iOS features for Facebook Messenger and launched to 16% of users with measurable impact.
